caption.title: UK Biobank phenotype data used in this study and their corresponding data fields.
caption.p: In parentheses are the units of measurements.

tr.td: Self-reported age at first sexual intercourse (years)

Self-reported category, encoded as an integer: 1, 'Daily or almost daily’; 2, 'Three or four times a week’; 3, 'Once or twice a week’; 4, 'One to three times a month’; 5, 'Special occasions only’; 6, 'Never’
Estimated from body composition impedance measurements (KJ)
Constructed from height and weight measurements (Kg/m2)
Measured using automated devices (mmHg); values are adjusted for medicine use (see Materials and methods)
Unweighted sum of the number of correct answers given to 13 fluid intelligence questions
Self-reported category, encoded as an integer: 1, 'Blonde’; 2, 'Red’; 3, 'Light brown’; 4, 'Dark brown’; 5, 'Black’; none, 'Other’
Measured right and left hand isometric grip strength (Kg)
Diagnoses made during hospital inpatient admissions, coded according to the International Classification of Diseases (ICD-9 and ICD-10)

Self-reported average total annual household income before tax category, encoded as an integer: 1, 'Less than £18,000'; 2, '£18,000 to £30,999'; 3, '£31,000 to £51,999'; 4, '£52,000 to £100,000'; 5, 'Greater than £100,000'
Algorithmically-defined myocardial infarction outcomes obtained through combinations of UK Biobank's assessment data collection (e.g., self-reported conditions), and data from hospital admissions
Derived summary score, based on participants’ responses to 12 neurotic behaviour-related questions
Sum of self-reported number of full brothers and full sisters
Self-reported category, encoded as an integer: 1, 'Excellent'; 2, 'Good'; 3, 'Fair'; 4, 'Poor’
Calculated for individuals who have ever smoked as the number of cigarettes smoked per day, divided by twenty, multiplied by the number of years of smoking (years)
Measured during the automated blood pressure readings (bpm)

Self-reported educational or professional qualifications, selected from: 'College or University degree', 'NVQ or HND or HNC or equivalent', 'Other professional qualifications eg: nursing, teaching', 'A levels/AS levels or equivalent', 'O levels/GCSEs or equivalent', 'CSEs or equivalent', or 'None of the above'
Self-reported sex and as determined from genotyping analysis
Self-reported category, encoded as an integer: 1, 'Very fair'; 2, 'Fair'; 3, 'Light olive'; 4, 'Dark olive'; 5, 'Brown'; 6, 'Black'
Self-reported vascular/heart problems diagnosed by doctor selected from the categories: 'Heart attack’, 'Angina', 'Stroke', 'High blood pressure', and 'None of the above'
